Name: Bead net from the mummy of Kheriru
Description: Little staff-shaped, smooth ribbed tubular beads of light blue glazed faience, with small circular beads where they join, together forming a net that covered the front of the mummy of Kheriru. The mummy fell into the hands of tomb robbers; only the beads of the destroyed net remained in the coffin. The net was reconstructed in modern times using similar bead nets of the same period as examples.
